title: Question 5
prompt: After scolding her for being a spendthrift, Torvald gives Nora money. What does this say about his character?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: Before Torvald offers Nora money, he notices that she seems upset. He says, “Is my little squirrel out of temper?” Immediately afterward, Torvald offers her money. This is cause and effect. Torvald sees that Nora is upset, and therefore he offers her a present of money. Torvald sees that Nora is upset: “What is this! Is my little squirrel out of temper?” Because Nora is upset, Torvald offers her money: “Nora, what do you think I have got here?” Even though Torvald thinks Nora spends too much, he softheartedly gives her money to please her when she is upset.
